intro: Boechera dentata var. phalacrocarpa, commonly known as the silverleaf rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of silvery-hairy leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Its foliage is covered in fine, glandular hairs that give it a distinctive silvery appearance. Boechera dentata var. phalacrocarpa is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
